comments:
Hi,

I'm using Eclipse 2.1 and I want to develop web-applications with it. I'm 
using Tomcat 5.0 with Sysdeo and Lomboz-Plugin.

If I try to start Tomcat within Eclipse, I always the the following error-log:


1. Plugin: org.eclipse.ui
Log Session (Session Data): 
java.version=1.4.2_01
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_DE
Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -install 
file:C:/Eclipse/eclipse/

Status Details:
Message: Unable to recreate perspective


2. Plugin: com.sysdeo.eclipse.tomcat
Status Details:
- Message: Starte Tomacat...
- Log Session (Session Data):
java.version=1.4.2_01
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_DE
Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -install 
file:C:/Eclipse/eclipse/

3. Plugin: org.eclipse.debug.ui
Log Session (Session Data):
java.version=1.4.2_01
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_DE
Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -install 
file:C:/Eclipse/eclipse/

Status Details:
- Message: Error logged from Debug UI:
- Exception:
java.version=1.4.2_01
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=de_DE
Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -install 
file:C:/Eclipse/eclipse/

Status Details:
org.eclipse.ui.WorkbenchException: Unable to recreate perspective
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.showPerspective
(Workbench.java:1531)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.launchConfigurations.PerspectiveManager$1.run
(PerspectiveManager.java:117)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages
(Synchronizer.java:98)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:1815)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1549)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1402)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:1385)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:858)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:291)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:747)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:583)



Do you have an idea?

bye
Chris

From your description, this doesn't look like a problem in the Eclipse debugger,
but in the plug-ins you are using. Please report the problem to the plug-in
providers.disableling

You may be able to workaround the problem by unsetting the preference to switch
perspective (should be somewhere in window>preferences>debug ...).
You should also check that the version of the plug-ins is compatible with the
version of Eclipse you are using.
You should think of moving to Eclipse 3.0 too.
